column2: During this daylong retreat, Ajahn Pasanno shares teachings and memories of his beloved teacher, Ajahn Chah. By the time of his passing in 1992, Ajahn Chah had become one of the most highly revered Buddhist meditation masters in Thailand. The readings come from a draft version of Ajahn Jayasaro's biography of Ajahn Chah that was published as [Stillness Flowing](Stillness Flowing) in 2018.

My connection with Ajahn Chah.
If you want to stay here, you have to stay at least five years.|Ajahn Chah
Jack Kornfield arrives with a large picture of Ajahn Chah.
The needlepoint Ajahn Chah portrait at Abhayagiri.

Stillness Flowing p. 39
Close the doors. I'm going to eat noodles today!|Ajahn Chah
from the [draft biography](): Ajahn Chah accepts his dying father's request to stay as a monk for life.
Stillness Flowing p. 40

I dedicate my body and mind, my whole life, to the practice of the Lord Buddha’s teachings in their entirety. I will realize the truth in this lifetime … I will let go of everything and follow the teachings. No matter how much suffering and difficulty I have to endure I will persevere, otherwise there will be no end to my doubts. I will make this life as even and continuous as a single day and night. I will abandon attachments to mind and body and follow the Buddha’s teachings until I know their truth for myself.|Ajahn Chah
Stillness Flowing p. 42
The singular quality of Ajahn Chah's resolution.
Ajahn Chah begins wandering in search of teachers.
from the [draft biography](): Ajahn Mun's character and legacy.
Stillness Flowing p. 52
Dhp 65, Dhp 92
Ajahn Mun disappears after being appointed abbot.
from the [draft biography](): Ajahn Chah visits Ajahn Mun.
Stillness Flowing p. 54
Aware of the in-breath, aware of the out-breath. ++Guided meditation++ from Ajahn Chah.
Collected Teachings p. 255 "Just Do It!"
The role of walking meditation.
Ajahn Chah admonishes the monks: "I've looked at the huts in the forest where you monks live. I see the walking meditation paths, and I don't see human tracks. All I see are dog tracks!"
Walking meditation instructions by Ajahn Chah and Ajahn Pasanno.
Collected Teachings p. 258 "Just Do It!"
Where we really start to see the Dhamma or taste the Dhamma is in that continuity of awareness.
Context of Ajahn Chah's early efforts at meditation.
Skillful effort in meditation.
Collected Teachings p. 467 "Unshakeable Peace"
The contemplation of conditionality leads to the Dhamma.
Meditation is like a single piece of wood. Insight is one end of the stick, and serenity is the other.
I sacrificed my life for the Dhamma because I had faith in the reality of enlightenment and the path to get there.|Ajahn Chah
The tradition of almsround.
The monks' requisites sustain our livelihood and are a focal point for our cultivation of mindfulness and attention.
A group of military generals ask Ajahn Chah to bless amulets to create a kitchen fund.
The Buddha set up the foundation 2,500 years ago with just one baht.|Ajahn Chah
Explanation of the meal blessing chant.
Chanting Book p. 50
++Anumodana chanting:++ "Yathā vāri-vahāpūrā..." and "Bhavatu sabba-maṅgalaṃ..." (Chanting Book p. 50) offered by the Abhayagiri Saṅgha.

You talked about having lost a gread deal of institutional knowledge in the Forest Tradition through not having monasteries. Do you think Ajahn Chah wanted to have the knowledge from Ajahn Mun passed down? Is that why he had lots of monasteries?
Nowadays there aren't any tudong monks left. There's only taludong (through the forest) monks.|Ajahn Chah

When you and other Western seekers went to Thailand [and returned to teach], are the teachings of lay and monastic disciples of Ajahn Chah the same or different? How can we as laypeople relate to the teachings and tradition of the monastic establishment?
Abhayagiri's bell is an American bomb casing.
Diligent lay meditators attend Wat Pah Pong's all-night vigil on the lunar observance days.
What characteristics differentiate Thai Buddhism from Tibetan Kadampa or Japanese Zen?
Why Ajahn Chah spent only three days with Ajahn Mun.
Stillness Flowing p. 61
Mahānikāya needs good monks as well.|Ajahn Mun to Ajahn Chah
from the [draft biography](): Ajahn Chah's mentors: Ajahn Tongrat and Ajahn Kinaree
Stillness Flowing p. 73
Ajahn Chah meets Ajahn Tongrat.
Ajahn Mun teaches his teacher, Ajahn Sao.
from the [draft biography](): Ajahn Chah leaves his companions and stays alone.
Stillness Flowing p. 89
Where is the good person? He lies within us. If we're good, then wherever we go, the goodness stays with us.|Ajahn Chah
++Guided meditation:++ Resolve right now is the time for training the mind and nothing else. From "[The Key to Liberation](https://www.budsas.org/ebud/ajchah_lib/03_meditation.htm)" by Ajahn Chah.
Sitting and walking meditation are in essence the same, differing only in the posture used.
Chicken in a coop.
Mindfulness, clear comprehension, and wisdom are like three workers lifting heavy planks.
The rythym of the sensation of the body as it is walking.
Beyond Doubt.

about how Ajahn Chah taught to deal with people externally.
A ghost tries to align the visitors sleeping in his hall.
You have to have an anchor in your own practice.
Did you as a Westerner have any difficulties meeting Ajahn Chah either with Buddhism or with Thailand? How did it get resolved or did it get resolved?
Ajahn Chah replies evasively when asked three straightforward questions to teach his translator (Ajahn Pasanno) a lesson.
As an abbot taking care of a community, how do you handle it when a kerfluffle comes up?
What are the antidotes to the next two Noble Truths?
When I'm mindful, then I become more aware of suffering. I could just go into story and not know that I'm suffering, so why would we choose to become aware of the suffering?
The flavor of the end of suffering—I like that.
Ajahn Chah's practice matures and he receives permission to teach.
